page.title: 19School Closures and Changes.
page.content: The National School at West Stour closed in 1927 and at East Stour in 1954.Kington Magna village school was closed in 1968.The children were transferred to Stour Provost.Able pupils took the 11+ examination and attended Gillingham Grammar,four miles away.On an adjoining site the Secondary Modern opened in 1940.This had its own smallholding and Rural Science was taught.All children over 11 years left their villages in buses for Gillingham.The two schools merged in 1958 as Gillingham School but the smallholding closed in 1982 as part of Government economies. In the near future schools may well use the system of Continental Day to solve the present conflict over responsibility for children during lunchtime at school.
